Submodules

rigel.plugins.manager module

class rigel.plugins.manager.PluginManager[source]

Bases: object

is_plugin_compliant(entrypoint: Type) → bool[source]

Ensure that a given plugin entrypoint class is an instance of rigel.plugins.Plugin.

Parameters:

entrypoint (Type) – The plugin entrypoint class.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if the plugin entrypoint class is an instance of

rigel.plugins.Plugin. False otherwise.

load(entrypoint: str, plugin_raw_data: Dict[str, Any], global_data: Dict[str, ComplexDataModel | bool | float | int | str], application: Application, providers_data: Dict[str, Any]) → Plugin[source]

Parse a list of plugins.

Parameters:

  • entrypoint (str) – The plugin entrypoint.

  • plugin_raw_data (PluginRawData) – The unprocessed plugin configuration data.

  • global_data (RigelfileGlobalData) – The global data.

  • application (Application) – The ROS application.

  • providers_data (Dict[str, Any]) – Dynamic data bank for providers.

Return type:

Plugin

Returns:

An instance of the specified plugin.

rigel.plugins.plugin module

class rigel.plugins.plugin.Plugin(raw_data: Dict[str, Any], global_data: Dict[str, ComplexDataModel | bool | float | int | str], application: Application, providers_data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Bases: object

This class specifies the interface that all plugins must comply with.

run() → None[source]

Use this function as an entry point for your plugin.

setup() → None[source]

Use this function to allocate plugin resoures.

stop() → None[source]

Use this function to gracefully clean plugin resources.
